FuncDescriptionShort: The reverse direction (Inverse) Two Dimensional Discrete Fourier Transform
FuncDescriptionLong: This function simply reverses the 2D Fourier Transform.  It takes as its input either a logical matrix containing Fourier coefficients in the form of complex number elements, or, alternatively, in the form of amplitude-phase pair (polar form) elements.   The function then runs them through a reverse-transform summation formula, and output the original logical matrix (original 2D array) that was input into the TD_DFFT2 to generate the Fourier coefficients.

Description: It takes as its input a logical matrix that has been populated previously with 2D Fourier Transform coefficients.  The calculated coefficients may exist in either the form of : complex numbers - real and imaginary pairs; or exist as amplitude-phase pairs.
Input.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Description: The output of the inverse transform is a result matrix containing magnitudes.  The indexes for the rows and columns will be monotonically increasing integers beginning from 0.

The TD_IDFFT2 function only returns a Primary Result set.  There are no Secondary or Tertiary Result sets returned by this function.  The Primary Result set can be returned by issuing a SELECT statement against the analytical result table containing the results.

The TD_IDFFT2 transforms the input frequency domain matrix, containing the Fourier coefficients as elements, back into a matrix containing time/space domain entries.    The elements of the result matrix are either CONTENT(COMPLEX) or CONTENT(MULTIVAR_COMPLEX).
Output.LangName: data or object or newdata or ... --> Langauges team can work with UAF team to come up with this field

Params.Name: HUMAN_READABLE
Description: Required Parameter when input rows are in raw format.  Informs the TD_IDDFT as to whether the incoming DFFT coefficient rows are in a human-readable / plottable form; or if they are output in the raw-form, which is equivalent to how the 'R' and 'PYTHON' programs produce DFFT results.     A value of '1' means true, output in human readable form; a value of '0' means false, output in raw form.  Default is true â€“ output in Human Readable format.

OutputFmt.Name: CONTENT
Description: The OUTPUT_FMT (CONTENT()) construct can be used by the data scientist to choose how they would like their Fourier coefficients to be output.  The can use CONTENT(COMPLEX) or CONTENT(MULTIVAR_COMPLEX) to request the Fourier coefficients in rectangular form.  Alternatively, they can use CONTENT(AMPL_PHASE_RADIANS), CONTENT(AMPL_PHASE_DEGREES), CONTENT(AMPL_PHASE), CONTENT(MULTIVAR_AMPL_PHASE_RADIANS), CONTENT(MULTIVAR_AMPL_PHASE), or CONTENT(MULTIVAR_AMPL_PHASE_DEGREES) to request that the Fourier coefficients be output in the polar form; and to further request the phase to be output in radians or degrees.
AMPL_PHASE is one of the permitted values, it is synonymous with AMPL_PHASE_RADIANS. Similarly MULTIVAR_AMPL_PHASE is equivalent to MULTIVAR_AMPL_PHASE_RADIANS.

The default value is dependent on the datatype of the input series; a single var input will generate COMPLEX output CONTENT by default; a multi var input will generate MULTIVAR_COMPLEX output CONTENT by default.
